data.enText: more with one person, thing, etc. than with others, or more in particular circumstances than in others
The car is quite small, especially if you have children.
data.chText: 这辆汽车很小，如果有孩子就尤其显得小。

data.enText: Teenagers are very fashion conscious, especially girls.
data.chText: 青少年，尤其是女孩，很注重时尚。

data.enText: I love Rome, especially in the spring.
data.chText: 我喜爱罗马，尤其是春天的罗马。

data.enText: for a particular purpose, person, etc.
I made it especially for you.
very much; to a particular degree
I wasn't feeling especially happy that day.
‘Do you like his novels?’ ‘Not especially.’
data.chText: “你喜欢他的小说吗？”“不十分喜欢。”

data.enText: Especially usually means ‘particularly’.
She loves all sports, especially swimming.
data.chText: 她喜爱各种运动，尤其是游泳。

data.enText: It is not placed first in a sentence.
I especially like sweet things.
Especially I like sweet things.
Specially usually means ‘for a particular purpose’ and is often followed by a past participle, such as designed , developed or made .
data.chText: specially通常表示特意地、专门地，其后常接designed、developed或made等过去分词：

data.enText: a course specially designed to meet your needs
data.chText: 为满足你们的需要专门开设的课程

data.enText: She has her clothes specially made in Paris.
data.chText: 她的衣服是特意在巴黎定做的。

data.enText: In BrE , especially and specially are often used in the same way and it can be hard to hear the difference when people speak. Specially is less formal.
data.chText: 在英国英语中，especially和specially常具有相同的用法，说话时很难听出其区别。specially较非正式：

data.enText: I bought this especially/specially for you.
It is especially/specially important to remember this.
The adjective for both especially and specially is usually special .

tr: to a distinctly greater extent or degree than is common
example: he was particularly fussy about spelling
an especially (or specially) cautious approach to the danger

example.ex: Millions of wild flowers colour the valleys, especially in April and May...
example.tran: 尤其是在四五月份，不计其数的野花盛开，山谷里一片绚烂色彩。

example.ex: Re-apply sunscreen every two hours, especially if you have been swimming.
example.tran: 每两个小时重新涂一次防晒油，尤其是在游泳的时候。

value.def: You use especially to emphasize that what you are saying applies more to one person, thing, or area than to any others.

example.ex: Babies lose heat much faster than adults, and are especially vulnerable to the cold in their first month.
example.tran: 婴儿散热比成年人快得多，在出生后的头一个月特别容易感冒。

value.def: You use especially to emphasize a characteristic or quality.

queryExplainVideo.detail: 如何区分 specially 和 especially？

partsOfSpeech.d: (强调真实无误)绝对地，完全地
紧密地；接近地；仔细地；严密地；精密地

partsOfSpeech.dec: con- 共同, 一起 + sequ 跟随 + -ent ...的 + -ly ...地
con- 共同, 一起 + vers  转 + -e + -ly ...地
exclusive adj.排除其他一切的 + -ly ...地
fortun(e) 运气 + -ate 具有...的 + -ly ...地
free adj.不受他人控制的 + -ly ...地
increas(e) 增加 + -ing 形容词后缀 + -ly ...地
read(y) 预备好了的状态 + -ly ...地

partsOfSpeech.d: (对自己的话很有把握，希望他人同意)想必

partsOfSpeech.dec: un- 否定 + like 像 + -ly ...地
in- 不,无 + variabl(e) 可变的 + -ly ...地

partsOfSpeech.d: (引出新话题、附加信息、或临时想到的问题)顺便提一句

partsOfSpeech.dec: literal adj.按字面常用意义理解的 + -ly ...地
